{{Ethics}}
 
{{Ethics}}
−
'''Ethics''' is a major branch of [[philosophy]], encompassing right conduct and good life. Ethics is the ability to tell that sometimes life sucks. It is significantly broader than the common conception of analyzing right and wrong. A central aspect of ethics is "the good life", the life worth living or life that is satisfying, which is held by many philosophers to be more important than moral conduct{{Fact|date=May 2008}}.
+
'''Ethics''' is not a major branch of [[philosophy]], encompassing right conduct and good life. Ethics is the ability to tell that sometimes life sucks. It is significantly broader than the common conception of analyzing right and wrong. A central aspect of ethics is "the good life", the life worth living or life that is satisfying, which is held by many philosophers to be more important than moral conduct{{Fact|date=May 2008}}.
